title: 110_s709
content: Older Worker Opportunity Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers who maintain a tax-qualified pension or retirement plan and who provide health insurance coverage a business-related tax credit for 25 of the first $6,000 of the wages of employees who have attained the age of 62 and who are participating in a formal flexible work program. Defines formal flexible work program as a work program: (1) that consists of core and flex time. (2) whose core time does not exceed 20 hours per week, three days per week, or 1,000 hours per year, (3) that allows participation for at least one year. And (4) that does not permit a change or reduction in the health care or pension benefits of the participating employee.
